sentences.english: In Hangzhou, there is a kind of water lily whose pads are so huge that a person can stand on them.
sentences.chinese: 在杭州有一種睡蓮，它的葉子大到上面可以站一個人。

sentences.english: The spent blooms and leaves of water lilies should also be removed.
sentences.chinese: 該花的花朵和葉片的睡蓮也應予以拆除。

sentences.english: A water lily glows in the aquatic plants area of San Francisco's Conservatory of Flowers.
sentences.chinese: 一支睡蓮在舊金山溫室花房的水生植物區熠熠綻放着。

sentences.english: In this paper, a cladistic analysis was applied to reveal the phylogenetic relationships among the Nymphaeaceae.
sentences.chinese: 本文用譜系分支法分析睡蓮科的屬間關係。

sentences.english: The water was only a few feet deep, but the lilies reached for the sky."--Frans Lanting
sentences.chinese: 水只有幾尺深，但是這些睡蓮的精神卻堪比天高。

sentences.english: The flower sweetens the air with its perfume;
sentences.chinese: 睡蓮，清淡型花香味印度香。

sentences.english: The world's biggest species of waterlily can have pads that grow to around 3m (10ft).
sentences.chinese: 這世界上最小的睡蓮的墊子能長到大約3米。

sentences.english: There are fewer frogs than lily pad.
The vivid colors of this lotus, its petals still covered with raindrops, were absolutely beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 這朵睡蓮色彩豔麗，花瓣帶雨，嬌美非常。

sentences.english: The Lotus leaf has been selected as organic and bio-climatic metaphor for proposal.
sentences.chinese: 我們選擇“白睡蓮”作爲有機學和生態氣候學的比喻。

sentences.english: Felix went to that great lily pad in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 費利克斯到天堂中的那片大睡蓮浮葉上去了。

sentences.english: This is a Victoria lily, the largest kind of water lily in the world.
sentences.chinese: 這就是王蓮，是世界上最大的睡蓮。

sentences.english: The bay where water lilies quietly floated is now a harbor for motor boats.
sentences.chinese: 睡蓮靜靜漂浮的湖灣，現在成了汽艇的避風港。

sentences.english: They had lotuses and water lilies in their hands and in the carts.
sentences.chinese: 他們手上拿着，車上裝着很多的荷花和睡蓮。

sentences.english: ChenYan son smell speech ask water lily is from the south.
sentences.chinese: 陳燕兒聞言追問睡蓮是否是南方人。

definition: national grace, divine fragrance (idiom); an outstanding beauty
tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
thousands of purples and reds (idiom); a blaze of color/fig. a profusion of flourishing trades
